meanings.definition: The state or quality of being a lady.
meanings.sent1: Her ladyships was evident in the graceful way she carried herself.
meanings.sent2: The ladyships of the queen was respected by all in the kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to mimic the ladyships of the elegant swan by gliding across the pond.
meanings.sent4: The ladyships of the rose stood out among the other flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The ladyships of the ballerina's movements captivated the audience.

meanings.definition: Used as a form of address for a woman of noble or high rank.
meanings.sent1: Excuse me, your ladyships, may I have a moment of your time?
meanings.sent2: The guests curtsied before the ladyships as she entered the room.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel chattered away, pretending to be of noble ladyships.
meanings.sent4: The ladyships of the ocean called to the sailors, guiding them safely to shore.
meanings.sent5: The ladyships of the mountain peak could be seen from miles away.
